publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3668 Margaret Smith: Fairbridge in Scotland—That the Parliament notes the recent annual review of Fairbridge in Scotland, No Laughing Matter; congratulates Fairbridge in Scotland on another successful year of working with more socially excluded young people in Glasgow, Edinburgh and Dundee than ever before; recognises the contribution made by Fairbridge in Scotland to tackling the NEETS agenda; considers that informal education and learning through experience play a vital part in the work of the voluntary sector in re-engaging with hard-to-reach young people, and welcomes the intention of Fairbridge to expand its services into other communities of need over the next four years. Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support

S2M-3668 Fairbridge in Scotland (lodged on 5 December 2005) Stewart Stevenson*, Colin Fox*, Alex Johnstone*, Marlyn Glen*, Mr David Davidson*, Euan Robson*, Mark Ballard*, Jackie Baillie*, Mr Andrew Arbuckle*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Mike Pringle*, Rosie Kane*

S2M-3668 Fairbridge in Scotland (lodged on 5 December 2005) Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Murdo Fraser*, Patrick Harvie*, Jeremy Purvis*, Nora Radcliffe*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Shiona Baird*, Bill Aitken*, Kate Maclean*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Frances Curran*, Mr Jim Wallace*, Richard Baker*, Margo MacDonald*, Robin Harper*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-3668 Fairbridge in Scotland (lodged on 5 December 2005) Scott Barrie*, Iain Smith*, Fiona Hyslop*

S2M-3668 Margaret Smith: Fairbridge in Scotland—That the Parliament notes the recent annual review of Fairbridge in Scotland, No Laughing Matter; congratulates Fairbridge in Scotland on another successful year of working with more socially excluded young people in Glasgow, Edinburgh and Dundee than ever before; recognises the contribution made by Fairbridge in Scotland to tackling the NEETS agenda; considers that informal education and learning through experience play a vital part in the work of the voluntary sector in re-engaging with hard-to-reach young people, and welcomes the intention of Fairbridge to expand its services into other communities of need over the next four years. Supported by: Stewart Stevenson, Colin Fox, Alex Johnstone, Marlyn Glen, Mr David Davidson, Euan Robson, Mark Ballard, Jackie Baillie, Mr Andrew Arbuckle, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Mike Pringle, Rosie Kane, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Murdo Fraser, Patrick Harvie, Jeremy Purvis, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Jamie Stone, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Shiona Baird, Bill Aitken, Kate Maclean, Mrs Nanette Milne, Frances Curran, Mr Jim Wallace, Richard Baker, Margo MacDonald, Robin Harper, Donald Gorrie, Scott Barrie, Iain Smith, Fiona Hyslop
S2M-3668 Fairbridge in Scotland (lodged on 5 December 2005) Mr Brian Monteith*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-3668 Fairbridge in Scotland (lodged on 5 December 2005) Nicola Sturgeon*
S2M-3668 Fairbridge in Scotland (lodged on 5 December 2005) Elaine Smith*
